intro: Staphidium minutiflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered staphidium, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is a small, deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters during the spring. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that matures to a reddish color.
